reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married at the Piersland recently and had a fantastic day. All the staff were friendly and helpful and made sure everything was perfect. All our guests commented on how beautiful the Hotel was and how excellent the food was. The wedding co-ordinator looking after us on the day was Michael and he was extremely friendly and professional and ensured the smooth running of the entire day. I would highly recommend the Piersland as a Wedding venue as well as having first class accommodation and food.
reviews.title: Fantastic Venue for Wedding

reviews.text: my first trip TripAdvisor post,comes from having my wedding at the piersland. From meeting karl the manager to saying goodbye to the lady on reception i could not pick a single fault, the hotel was excellent,clean and fresh,the food was first class, the staff really made our 2 day stay and wedding a total success,Michael the wedding co ordinator stood out as the star of the show and treated my wife and i as if it was his first wedding and not a single thing was a problem 10/10
reviews.title: peirsland wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married here on 12th May and know we made the right venue choice. The manager who hosted our day (Martin) was professional and helpful and made sure the day went smoothly. The food was fantastic and everyone who stayed loved their rooms. Great area for the kids to play in and fantastic service all round. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the lodges, on the left at the entrance. They were great, plenty of room and spotless.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wedding on at the same time and staying over in the lodges was ideal, we did not hear anything from the wedding guests.
reviews.title: what a wonderful wedding day at piersland house.

reviews.text: We had a fabulous time with you, The hotel ,the staff, the food were brilliant and the weather was kind to us. We look forward to a return visit to the Piersland.
reviews.title: our june break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Piersland to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We had booked the Spring into Summer 2 night DB&B package which was extremely good value for money. The food in the Red Bowl restaurant was top class and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Only downside for my husband was he couldn't access the Sky Sports channels. We reported this to reception but it wasn't sorted by the time we were due to leave. All in all a wonderful stay and I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Anniversary Getaway
Great Experience!
reviews.text: Great location, good and reasonably-priced food, good portions, Lisa and Amy behind the bar--what more could one ask for?

I organized our annual golf week for 20 people to be based at Troon this year and booked the Piersland House Hotel for our accommodation. From the time I first was in connection with them until check-out, all was just excellent. Their service was stellar, the food was excellent, the grounds are lovely, the rooms updated and comfortable, the ambiance wonderful. In the 7 days we were there, I did not get a single complaint from any of our players on any aspect. Without question, we will go back there the next time we hold our golf program in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful All Round

reviews.text: We have stayed in the Piersland 4 times and each time booked a Cottage Suite, they are off to the side of the hotel and look like a long L shaped row of cottages, with each " cottage " an individual suite, a nice entrance into a sitting area with flat screen TV, a large separate bedroom with bath and shower and of course another flat screen TV, bed very comfortable, we usually eat in the "Walker " bar on the Friday evening, food is excellent and well presented, staff are friendly and remember you from previous visits, we always pay the supplement for the cooked breakfast a good way to start the day, not Buffet, but an extensive breakfast menu, very relaxing, no hassle, no hurry an excellent way to relax and unwind, no smoking throughout ( my wife smokes ) Cottage Suite allows her and me to step outside sit down and relax with, for me, a nice Cigar and for her a Cigarette and a few glasses of Bubbly, house has ties to the Walker Whisky family and is a listed building, fabulous wood carvings from the far East and Tapestries abound. Some of the Cottage Suites are pet friendly, a place to be on a nice summer evening.
reviews.title: 2 nights in Troon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great deal on a Sunday dinner, bed and breakfast price of £85. Our room was in the house itself and was very comfortable with an en-suite shower room. The food is excellent and very good value. All the staff in the restaurant are very pleasant and friendly without being over familiar. The breakfast has an excellent choice of and the kippers are the best I have ever had. This was the seventh time we had stayed in the hotel since November 2011 and we will definitely be back. It would be fair to say that this is our favourite hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Had a great time with our one night stay in room 23 (cottage suite). Room very clean but could do with a freshen up - wallpaper marked in places and general decor bit out of touch but still nice enough. Can't rate our dinner highly enough. The waiter (Alan I think) was attentive and food was excellent. At night we realised that there was a noise from either air con or extractor at back of kitchen which was quite noisy for us. Would stay again but possibly try other room to see if decor any better.
reviews.title: Great service, excellent food - bit noisy
Daughter's wedding reception.
reviews.text: As Mother of the Bride, I would like to complement the Piersland Hotel on it's excellent service and unobtrusive organisation of the wedding reception.
All staff were so friendly and helpful, food was wonderful and accommodation perfect for all our guests.
reviews.title: Beautiful old world charm!

reviews.text: Everyone, that I have spoken to, who attended the wedding was, like me full of praise for the Piersland.
reviews.title: Perfect break
Good value, nicely renovated hotel
reviews.text: We had heard that the food was good at this hotel, and a contact of my husband's recommended it as they stay there regularly. They told him about the special offers they currently have and we booked the Sunday Night DB&B offer of £85.

reviews.title: Great home-from-home
reviews.text: We booked a Lodge room, which is separate from the main hotel. There are 7 or 8 of these rooms overlooking the golf course, which are only 2 years old and still look brand new. Very spacious room and we were able to park right outside. Bottled water & fruit were in the room on arrival, and lovely bathroom with an excellent powerful shower and fluffy towels. The only complaint about the room was that I think the bed was much older than the building, it sagged in the middle which was somewhat uncomfortable - OK if you're sleeping alone, but if there are 2 of you it feels like you're sleeping on a slope.

reviews.title: Great place!!
reviews.text: It was an unusually nice day for this depressingly wet summer, and we sat outside on the decking with a g&t, which was lovely. The hotel was very busy for lunch and there was also a function on, a christening I think.

reviews.title: Excellent, well worth the money
reviews.text: We had booked dinner for 7.30pm, and it was reasonably busy for a Sunday evening. The offer includes a 3 course table d'hote menu with tea/coffee, or alternatively you can choose a la carte with a £15 allowance per person. The a la carte menu is very reasonably priced, however we chose the table d'hote which gave a very good choice. The food was excellent and very plentiful, and service was very efficient and relaxed.

reviews.title: Lovely Setting- hotel a disappointment
reviews.text: The hotel is quite old, but has been beautifully refurbished in a modern but classic style. We went back to our room with a drink after dinner as my husband wanted to watch football on the TV.
